{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481827,"name":"Alice Kuznetsov","username":"acat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/acat/{size}/245179_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T05:51:23.865Z","cooked":"

We were calibrating our limelight for the 2025 season and experienced issues converting it to the 2025 tags. It’s kinda hard to tell from this picture, but we’re practically right up against the reef; definitely not completely outside of the reef zone (which isn’t taped on our field). We still saw about this amount of error when right against the reef.

FieldImage1200×1600 194 KB

firefox_HNFEq741M51920×1080 289 KB

image548×531 52 KB

Brief summary of what we’ve tried

We initially saw this issue with our limelight on our “protobot” (the other robot in the picture). We assumed we had calculated the limelight position wrong, so we tried uploading the 2025 .fmap to our 2024 Offseason robot (the robot pictured), knowing it must have a correct position in the config since it worked at Beach Blitz. Our only change was uploading the .fmap, but we saw the same amount of error looking at this tag. Turning the robot to face the Coral Loading Station tag moved the robot slightly (just enough to indicate that it saw the tag) but not enough to account for the error. Both robots are using limelight 3gs mounted in different locations, leading me to think it’s not an issue with the localization setup. We don’t have any other tags set up.

We’re thinking it could be one of these 3 things and would like your help :]

  1. We missed something in the migration process to 2025
  2. Our field is taped wrong/AprilTags are in the wrong spot
  3. Limelight issue with the 2025 .fmap

Your April Tag looks kind of small. If the white paper it is on is 8.5"x11", the black part should be 6.5" with a 1" margin of white space on both sides.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T01:53:53.083Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":52.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481593,"topic_slug":"limelight-not-matching-2025-field","display_username":"Alice Kuznetsov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57230,"username":"acat","name":"Alice Kuznetsov","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/acat/{size}/245179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57230,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3255 Alum - They/Them"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-not-matching-2025-field/481593/9","custom_user_title":"3255 Alum - They/Them","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3482984,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T02:43:59.518Z","cooked":"

I just did my own conversion of the FMAP and it seems to match the limelight one. Do you get the same amount of error on different tags? I noticed both your results and @Joseph_Amador results show the robot pose biased to the left of the field in advantage scope.
The field got a little more than 3 feet longer this year, maybe there is an issue with the field scaling in the visualizer?

From my earlier testing the red side would tend to phase into the reef while blue would be too far away. Don’t have exact numbers.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T02:49:21.368Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481593,"topic_slug":"limelight-not-matching-2025-field","display_username":"Joseph Gonzalo Amador","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57242,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Joseph Amador"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-not-matching-2025-field/481593/11","custom_user_title":"Joseph Amador","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3483018,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T03:07:10.636Z","cooked":"

I think the issue would be caused if you are using botposered or botposeblue. Those coordinate system conversions were based on the old field dimensions, which changed in 2025. The 2024 version of limelight would still be using those old field dimensions.

If you used botpose, then added 8.7736 to x and 4.0257 to y (half the field), does that give you a more accurate pose?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T03:08:34.426Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481593,"topic_slug":"limelight-not-matching-2025-field","display_username":"Joseph Gonzalo Amador","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57242,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Joseph Amador"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-not-matching-2025-field/481593/13","custom_user_title":"Joseph Amador","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3483053,"name":"Alice Kuznetsov","username":"acat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/acat/{size}/245179_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T04:00:11.200Z","cooked":"

Tried this and the issue appears to have gone away on the blue alliance. I didn’t try the red side as we only have a blue-side field.
I unfortunately didn’t get any photos of it but going up to the reef seemed to be accurate. I would still like to use getBotPoseEstimate_wpiBlue_MegaTag2 though; is there any way to update the field size in Limelight Helpers do we we just need to wait for a limelight update? I couldn’t see anywhere to input it.

I think just updating your firmware to the newest firmware release of Limelight should be a proper solution to the problem. I can’t confirm it 100% yet (we haven’t had a meeting since the release) but I will be updating it on Friday and hopefully posting it as a solution :]

If that doesn’t work, here’s what I quickly wrote up to test @KH987’s theory. The timestamp part irks me so it’s probably wrong haha

Pose2d pose = LimelightHelpers.getBotPose2d("limelight");
    if (!pose.equals(new Pose2d())) {
      subDrivetrain.addVisionMeasurement(
          new Pose2d(pose.getX() + 8.7736, pose.getY() + 4.0257, subDrivetrain.getRotation()),
          Timer.getFPGATimestamp());
    }
